senses.de: A long, flat, thin piece of wood or other hard material
senses.ex: She cut the cheese on a wooden board.

Tips.title: Material Varieties
Tips.description: The word 'board' can refer to materials other than wood, like plastic or metal boards.
Tips.example: The students used a large plastic board for their project.

Tips.title: Physical Descriptions
Tips.description: 'Board' often implies a smooth, flat surface and can vary in size and thickness.
Tips.example: The craftsman polished the board until it was perfectly smooth.

senses.de: To get on a train, plane, or ship

Tips.title: Transportation Context
Tips.description: When used as a verb, 'board' typically involves a process or line before entry.
Tips.example: We waited to board the ship, tickets in hand.

Tips.title: Immediacy
Tips.description: Telling someone to 'board' can suggest urgency, like needing to hurry.
Tips.example: Please board quickly, the bus is about to leave!

senses.de: A group of people who have power to make decisions and control a company or other organization
senses.ex: The board of directors has approved the budget for next year.

Tips.title: Decision Authority
Tips.description: This 'board' is about people in charge; they make important decisions.
Tips.example: The board will meet next week to decide on the merger.

Tips.title: Formality Level
Tips.description: Discussing 'the board' usually occurs in formal or professional contexts.
Tips.example: She presented her proposal to the board in the quarterly meeting.

senses.ex: Room and board is included in the price.

Tips.title: Accommodation Inclusion
Tips.description: Here, 'board' means meals are included with lodging for one price.
Tips.example: The hotel offers room and board for all its guests.

Tips.title: Travel Relevance
Tips.description: Understanding 'board' is useful when traveling, to know if meals are provided.
Tips.example: Does the price include board, or should we find restaurants?

senses.de: To cover or close with pieces of wood

Tips.title: Protection or Privacy
Tips.description: When you 'board up' something, it often suggests a need for security or privacy.
Tips.example: They boarded up the house before the storm arrived.

Tips.title: Temporary Closure
Tips.description: 'Board up' can also mean that a place is temporarily closed or not in use.
Tips.example: The boarded-up store will reopen after renovations.

senses.de: A thin, flat piece of material with a special function
senses.ex: He got on his surfboard and rode the wave.

Tips.title: Specific Function
Tips.description: This 'board' refers to items designed for specific activities or uses.
Tips.example: He adjusted the bindings on his snowboard before heading downhill.

Tips.title: Sports Equipment
Tips.description: 'Board' can indicate specialized equipment in sports, like surfing or skateboarding.
Tips.example: She waxed her surfboard to improve grip on the water.

Chart.wordDefinition:
Chart is a graphical representation of data or information.

So, in simple terms, a board is a surface, while a chart is a visual representation of data.

Committee.wordDefinition:
A committee is a smaller group of people who are tasked with a specific project or objective, such as organizing an event or conducting research.

Committees are usually created by a larger group or governing body, such as a board, to focus on a particular area. A board is more general and has more power, while a committee is more specific and has less power.

Council.wordDefinition:
A council is a group of people who are elected or appointed to represent a larger group, such as a city or community. The council makes decisions and creates policies that affect the entire community.

A board is used for managing a company or organization, while a council is used for governing a larger group or community.

Panel.wordDefinition:
Panel generally refers to a flat section or piece of material that is one of many others, often used to make walls or screens.

To summarize, boards are generally stand-alone surfaces, while panels are part of a larger structure or system.

Plank.wordDefinition:
A board is generally a flat rectangular piece of wood that is thicker and wider than a plank.

A plank is a thinner and longer flat piece of wood that is often used for flooring, decking, and siding. Planks are also utilized in woodworking and crafting for creating decorative features and furniture.

In summary, while both are pieces of wood, boards are thicker and shorter, while planks are longer and thinner. Boards are primarily used in construction, while planks are used in both construction and woodworking.

Sheet.wordDefinition:
Sheet typically refers to a thin, flat piece of material, such as paper or fabric.

Sheets can be used for a variety of purposes, such as wrapping, covering, or as a component of bedding.

Board refers to a flat, rigid surface used for writing, drawing or displaying information, while sheet refers to a thin, flat piece of material.

Slab.wordDefinition:
Board and slab are both flat surfaces, but there are some differences:

Slab is a thicker and heavier flat surface that is made of concrete, stone, or even wood. Slabs are commonly used for building foundations, countertops, or even as a decorative element.

You would use the term board in reference to a thin flat piece of wood, while slab is more appropriate when referring to a thicker, heavier and more durable surface, made of concrete or stone.

Surface.wordDefinition:
Surface is a broader term that refers to the outermost layer of an object. This can include anything from the top of a table to the skin of an apple.

Board refers specifically to a flat, rectangular piece of material used for specific activities, while surface refers more broadly to the outer layer of any object.

Table.wordDefinition:
Both board and table refer to flat and usually rectangular surfaces, but they are used in different contexts.

A table is a piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs used for supporting objects or people. Tables often have a specific use, such as dining tables, coffee tables, and study tables.

In summary, while both board and table refer to flat surfaces, a board is usually a functional surface used for specific tasks, while a table is a piece of furniture used for supporting objects or people.

quotes.Text: In my work, I just want to tell a story and help people go on a journey. I'm glad any fans that I do have, and I'm usually not aware of it until I get out there or read a message board. I want to thank everyone who follows my work.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kenny Johnson

quotes.Text: It's the game of life. Do I win or do I lose? One day they're gonna shut the game down. I gotta have as much fun and go around the board as many times as I can before it's my turn to leave.
quotes.Title: American Rapper
quotes.Name: Tupac Shakur

quotes.Text: With every positive, there is a negative across the board in life. It's about choosing to see the positive and working with the negative.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Kate Gosselin

quotes.Text: A lot of teams see Lord's as a special place and up their games to try to get their names on the honours' board.

quotes.Text: Boarding school didn't feel like my world, I felt like an alien; people there had a lot of money.

quotes.Text: Every manager feels a responsibility to his board of directors and the public and the players.

quotes.Text: Bellator is collecting talent, collecting world-level talent all across the board.

quotes.Text: The board gets upset because I won't take a raise, but I've got plenty of money.

quotes.Text: It's very important to get friends on board, friends who make a difference.

quotes.Text: Life is a full-contact sport, and there's a score up on the board.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Phil McGraw
